item.title: How To Watch NBA Games on TV: Your 2025–2026 Streaming & Channel Guide
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
The NBA’s new media deal is here, and it’s a bit of a mess. That’s why we’ve created this ultimate fan’s guide to navigating channel lineups and the best TV services.

The post How To Watch NBA Games on TV: Your 2025–2026 Streaming & Channel Guide appeared first on CableTV.com.

Data effective as of post date. Offers and availability may vary by location and are subject to change.

The NBA has completely altered the way you watch games. Through the league’s new media deal, TNT Sports is out and a duo of new partners (NBCUniversal and Amazon) is in. This change means games are now spread across more channels and streaming services than ever before.

For fans, this new setup can feel like a full-court press. You’ve now got your local regional sports network (RSN), a handful of national channels, and two exclusive streaming services to keep track of. It’s a lot, and figuring it all out is a real challenge.

That’s where this guide comes in. I’ve drawn up a game plan to give you a simple, one-stop playbook for the 2025–2026 NBA season. I’ll cover the channels you need and recommend the best TV packages so you don’t miss a single game.

Jump to:

  • NBA channels
  • NBA key dates
  • Best ways to watch the NBA
  • Watch NBA games for free

Level up your NBA viewing experience!

If your internet isn’t fast enough to stream live TV, you’ve got two options: get faster internet or find a traditional TV provider. Enter your zip code below, and we’ll help you find providers for either solution.

What TV channels show NBA games?

For the 2025–2026 season, the NBA’s national broadcast lineup has a brand-new look. The primary national broadcasters are now ABC, ESPN, and NBC. You’ll also find a new slate of exclusive, high-profile games streaming on Amazon Prime Video and Peacock. And of course, NBA TV still has its own schedule of can’t-miss matchups.

Games that aren’t on national TV will require a different setup. Local fans will need access to their regional sports network for in-market coverage, while out-of-market fans must subscribe to NBA League Pass. To see the exact channel lineup for your favorite team, check out our dedicated watch guides in the drop-down menu below.

How to watch your favorite NBA team

  • Atlanta Hawks
  • Boston Celtics
  • Brooklyn Nets
  • Charlotte Hornets
  • Chicago Bulls
  • Cleveland Cavaliers
  • Dallas Mavericks
  • Denver Nuggets
  • Detroit Pistons

  • Houston Rockets
  • Indiana Pacers
  • Los Angeles Clippers

  • Memphis Grizzlies
  • Miami Heat
  • Milwaukee Bucks
  • Minnesota Timberwolves

  • New York Knicks
  • Oklahoma City Thunder
  • Orlando Magic
  • Philadelphia 76ers
  • Phoenix Suns
  • Portland Trail Blazers
  • Sacramento Kings
  • San Antonio Spurs
  • Toronto Raptors
  • Utah Jazz
  • Washington Wizards

NBA schedule: Key dates for the 2025–2026 season

The NBA season is more than just an 82-game grind. It’s a marathon packed with an in-season tournament, holiday spectacles, and long-running rivalries. I’ve already marked my calendar for the major highlights, especially the return of NBA on NBC for the first time in over two decades.

To help you plan your viewing around the season’s biggest moments, I’ve laid out all the key dates below. But you’ll also want to visit the official NBA schedule for the most up-to-the-minute TV calendar.

  • NBA Tip-Off: Tuesday, Oct. 21
  • NBA Cup: Begins Friday, Oct. 31
  • NBA on Christmas Day: Thursday, Dec. 25
  • NBA on MLK Day: Monday, Jan. 19
  • 2026 NBA All-Star: Friday, Feb. 13 – Sunday, Feb. 15
  • NBA Play-In Tournament: Tuesday, April 14 – Friday, April 17
  • NBA Playoffs: Begins Saturday, April 18
  • NBA Finals: Begins Thursday, June 4

Best TV providers for NBA games

With the NBA’s new media deal, there’s no single service that gets you every game. My recommendation is to build your own perfect package. You’ll need a great foundational live TV provider for your local RSN and the core national channels, plus a few essential streaming services for the exclusive games. To make it simple, here are my top picks for each category.

  • Editor’s Choice: Stream with DIRECTV ($89.99–$169.99/mo.*)
  • Essential Streaming Exclusives: Amazon Prime Video ($8.99–$17.98/mo.)
  • Your Home for Monday Hoops: Peacock ($10.99–$16.99/mo.)
  • Best for Out-of-Market Games: NBA League Pass ($16.99–$24.99/mo.)

Combining a service like DIRECTV with Prime Video, Peacock, and NBA League Pass is the only way to guarantee you’ll have access to every local, national, and out-of-market game this season. It’s a bit of a puzzle (a really expensive one at that), but this combination gives you the most complete picture.

Editor’s Choice: Stream with DIRECTV

Editorial rating (3.6/5)
Price:
$89.99–$169.99/mo.*
NBA channels:
ABC, ESPN, NBC, and NBA TV
Features:
Unlimited DVR storage; wide RSN availability
View Plans for DIRECTV STREAM
Read DIRECTV STREAM review

Data effective as of post date. Offers and availability may vary by location and are subject to change.

*for 24 months plus taxes and fees w/ 24-mo. agmt.; AutoPay and Paperless Bill req’d. Advanced Receiver Service Fee $15/mo. is extra and applies.

Pros

  • Large channel counts
  • Wide selection of RSNs
  • Excellent app features

Cons

  • Expensive plans
  • No NBA League Pass add-on

Stream with DIRECTV’s CHOICE plan and above comes with ESPN and NBA TV. You’ll also get your local ABC and NBC channels and regional sports networks based on your billing location, giving you nearly complete local and primetime NBA coverage. That’s what makes DIRECTV an excellent foundational live TV service.

I don’t recommend going beyond the CHOICE plan because it’s expensive—even compared to Fubo, Hulu + Live TV, and YouTube TV. But no other live TV streaming service offers the same comprehensive RSN and national coverage.

You’ll still run into blackouts with DIRECTV when it comes to out-of-market games. Previously, you could add NBA League Pass as a monthly add-on to avoid those blackouts. But now, you’ll need a standalone League Pass subscription through NBA.com or Amazon Prime Video.

Overall, DIRECTV sets you up nicely for watching live sports and entertainment. I know keeping up with all that content can be a challenge, but all DIRECTV customers get unlimited DVR storage.** You’ll even get multiview channels to catch sports and news happening all at once, a fantastic feature for staying connected.

View DIRECTV Plans

Essential Streaming Exclusives: Amazon Prime Video

Editorial rating (3.5/5)
Price:
$8.99–$17.98/mo.
NBA content:
Every NBA on Prime matchup, plus studio shows and analysis
Features:
Exclusive live sports; vast content library and add-on options
View Plans
Read Prime Video review

Data effective as of post date. Compatible device and internet connection required. Offers and availability may vary by location and are subject to change.

Pros

  • 66 exclusive regular-season games
  • Innovative playback features
  • NBA League Pass add-on options

Cons

  • Cluttered interface
  • No cable or satellite TV alternative

Amazon Prime Video now serves as the exclusive home for a huge lineup of national NBA games. Each season, the streaming service will carry Thursday and Friday night doubleheaders, the entire NBA Cup knockout stage, and the Play-In Tournament. Whether you need a subscription really depends on your favorite team’s schedule, but if you want to follow some of the league’s biggest moments, Prime Video is now essential.

What excites me the most about the NBA on Prime Video is the broadcast features. You’ll get Multiview capabilities, a Key Moments option to rewatch big plays, and my personal favorite, Rapid Recap. I’ve used Rapid Recap during Thursday Night Football, and it’s a slick, seamless way to get caught up on the action if you’re joining a live game late.

Of course, the one major downside is that these Prime Video games are streaming exclusives. That’s a tough pill to swallow for traditional cable and satellite subscribers who lack access to high-speed internet.

On the flip side, Prime Video allows you to bundle additional subscriptions conveniently. You can get add-on channels like NBA League Pass, Peacock Premium Plus, and even FanDuel Sports Network RSNs directly through Amazon. There’s also a deep library of TV shows and movies to enjoy on Prime Video between games.

View Prime Video Plans

Your Home for Monday Hoops: Peacock

Editorial rating (3.8/5)
Price:
$10.99–$16.99/mo.
NBA content:
Exclusive Monday night games and all NBC simulcasts
Features:
All NBA on NBC coverage; extensive on-demand content library
View Plans for Peacock
Read Peacock review

Data effective as of post date. Compatible device and internet connection required. Offers and availability may vary by location and are subject to change.

Pros

  • 100+ NBA games
  • Interactive Multiview and Performance View features
  • NBC Sports RSN add-ons

Cons

  • Lackluster TV and movie originals
  • No cable or satellite TV alternative

The biggest reason to grab a Peacock Premium subscription this NBA season is simple: exclusive Monday night games. The NBCUniversal service is the new, exclusive home for a slate of marquee Monday matchups. Plus, every single NBA game on NBC will stream live on Peacock, giving you another convenient way to tune in.

Just like with Prime Video, the major drawback here is the streaming exclusivity. I find it incredibly frustrating that fans must add yet another subscription to their TV lineup just to follow the NBA. On the bright side, some traditional providers (like Spectrum and Xfinity) include Peacock in select base plans, which might help soften the blow.

But it’s not all bad news, especially if you’re into what else Peacock has to offer. While Peacock’s on-demand library isn’t as deep as some of its competitors, I consider it an essential service for any serious sports fan. Premium subscriptions include live NFL games, Big Ten college sports, Premier League soccer, and the Olympics.

Lastly, I can’t wrap up this section without mentioning a noteworthy feature for some local fans. Anyone in the Boston Celtics, Golden State Warriors, Philadelphia 76ers, and Sacramento Kings TV markets can subscribe to their NBC Sports regional channel as a direct add-on through Peacock. If you’re an in-market fan of one of those teams, this is a fantastic perk that could put most of your basketball viewing all in one app.

View Peacock Plans

Best for Out-of-Market Games: NBA League Pass

Editorial rating (4.1/5)
Price:
$16.99–$24.99/mo.
NBA content:
Every out-of-market NBA game live and on-demand
Free trial:
7 days
View Plans for NBA League Pass
Read NBA League Pass review

Data effective as of post date. Offers and availability may vary by location and are subject to change. Blackout restrictions apply.

Pros

  • Home and away team broadcast feeds
  • Access to every NBA game replay
  • Live in-game stats on select devices

Cons

  • No live local or primetime games
  • Delayed replay access for blacked-out games

I’ve already mentioned NBA League Pass several times because it’s for out-of-market fans and anyone who wants to stay on top of every league storyline. Following the new NBA media deal, you can no longer get League Pass as an add-on to most live TV services. Instead, you must sign up directly on NBA.com or through Amazon Prime Video’s channels hub. (Fortunately, it’s still available as an add-on to cable and satellite TV customers.)

The greatest benefit of NBA League Pass is its live access to all games outside your local area. But the service doesn’t include live nationally broadcast games like the NBA Playoffs. While you can watch those games on demand three hours after they air, waiting that long sure feels like a penalty in the streaming era.

NBA League Pass starts at $16.99 per month. That’s much cheaper than the comparable MLB.TV ($29.99 a month) and NFL Sunday Ticket ($378.00 a season for returning users on YouTube TV) out-of-market packages.

If you want to upgrade to no commercials, you can jump up to the $24.99-a-month NBA League Pass Premium plan. Otherwise, there’s NBA Team Pass for $13.99 a month, which gets you every non-blackout game for one team of your choice. The NBA also offers League Pass Audio for a one-time fee of $9.99 if you only want radio streams.

Beyond live and on-demand games, NBA League Pass comes with live NBA TV access and hosts classic games and archived series like NBA Hardwood Classics. You can even relive great basketball moments like Michael Jordan’s 63-point game vs. the Boston Celtics or Kobe Bryant’s 81-point game vs. the Toronto Raptors.

View NBA League Pass Plans

How to watch NBA games for free

Get Free Local Channels
Editorial rating (4.5/5)
Recommended antenna:
Mohu Leaf 50 ($46.99, one-time purchase†)
NBA channels:
ABC and NBC
Features:
All local broadcast channels
View on Amazon
Read Mohu Leaf review

†CableTV.com utilizes paid Amazon links. Amazon.com Price; $46.99 (as of 7/25/25 11:20 a.m. CT). Read full disclaimer.

There are a few ways to get free access to NBA basketball, like taking advantage of free trial periods through streaming services like DIRECTV, Fubo, and YouTube TV. But the most reliable free way to watch NBA games is by using an over-the-air (OTA) antenna.

With several NBA matchups airing on ABC and NBC—including the entire NBA Finals—an antenna will get you live access as long as you’re within the range of network affiliates. Sure, antennas aren’t free. But a simple one-time purchase will set you up with live sports for many years—including a lot of college basketball if CBS is in your area.

Pro tip: You can verify which local channels an antenna can pick up by entering your zip code on the FCC’s Reception Map Tool.

One of my favorite antennas is the Mohu Leaf 50. It can receive TV signals from up to 60 miles away and has 4K capabilities. But if you want something cheaper or more robust, you can check out our complete Best Antennas for Cord-Cutters guide.

How to watch NBA games FAQ

Can I watch NBA games without cable?

Yes, the best way to watch NBA games without cable is with a live TV streaming service like DIRECTV or Fubo, which will get you most of the core national and regional channels. To be a true completist, you’ll also need separate subscriptions to Amazon Prime Video and Peacock for their exclusive games, plus NBA League Pass for out-of-market coverage.

Can I just buy NBA TV?

Yes, NBA TV is a channel included in most TV providers’ higher-tiered plans. But you can also purchase NBA TV as a standalone subscription for $6.99 a month through the same site that offers NBA League Pass.

Can I watch NBA on Amazon Prime?

Yes, you can watch many live NBA games on Amazon Prime Video. You can even level up the number of games you see by purchasing Prime Video’s Peacock and NBA League Pass channel add-ons. Plus, you can watch select WNBA games on Prime Video during the summer.

How can I watch NBA Summer League?

The NBA Summer League usually takes place in July, with games airing on NBA TV and ESPN channels. Sling TV offers the cheapest way to tune in through its Sling Orange plan ($45.99/mo.) with the Sports Extra add-on ($11.00/mo.).

How can I show NBA games at my bar or restaurant?

Commercial venues should contact a TV provider like DIRECTV FOR BUSINESS or Spectrum Business TV to get national NBA channels and NBA League Pass coverage. But first, I recommend contacting distributor EverPass Media to review all your programming options—especially for streaming exclusives from Prime Video and Peacock Sports Pass.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com Sports Editor, Taylor Kujawa, has been keeping tabs on the NBA for over 15 years. When the league announced its latest media rights deal, Taylor knew immediately the TV shake-up would throw fans for a loop. That’s why he’s tracked every detail of the carriage agreement from the league and each broadcaster very closely.

To create this guide, Taylor combined that industry knowledge with hands-on testing of every major TV provider. He then cross-referenced CableTV.com’s existing TV guides and resources to determine the best ways to watch the NBA this season, from must-have streaming services to nice-to-have live TV providers. Visit our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

Game day starts here!

  • How To Watch Local NBA Games
  • How To Watch the WNBA
  • How To Watch College Basketball
  • Best Streaming Services for Sports

Disclaimer

Data effective as of post date. Offers and availability may vary by location and are subject to change.

*Price subj. to change for new and existing customers.

**Data connection req’d. Recordings expire after 9 months. In a series recording, max 30 episodes stored with unlimited hours of cloud DVR and max 10 episodes stored with 20 hours of cloud DVR (oldest deleted first which may be in less than 9 months). Restrictions apply.

†Amazon.com price as of 7/25/25 11:20 a.m. CT. Product prices and availability are accurate as of the date/time indicated and are subject to change. Any price and availability information displayed on Amazon.com at the time of purchase will apply to the purchase of this product. CableTV.com utilizes paid Amazon links.

Certain content that appears on this site comes from Amazon. This content is provided “as is” and is subject to change or removal at any time.

item.title: How To Watch the Golden State Warriors in 2025
item.dc:creator: Eric Chiu
item.description:
Will Golden State make it back to the top of the NBA? Check out our 2025–2026 Golden State Warriors season watch guide.

The post How To Watch the Golden State Warriors in 2025 appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

The Golden State Warriors had an up-and-down 2024–2025 season that actually ended in a ton of upside. They traded away one half of the Splash Brothers in Klay Thompson and still got off to a hot start, but lost steam. The trade for Jimmy Butler turned things around, though, and the Dubs made it all to the second round of the playoffs in the Western Conference.

Coming into the 2025–2026 season, there’s plenty of reason to believe a full season of Jimmy Butler, the continued magic of Steph Curry, and the almost-certain addition of Al Horford will make the Warriors a force in the West.

Keep up with all the intrigue—including the Jonathan Kuminga contract saga—with our comprehensive watch guide for the 2025–2026 Golden State Season. Read on to find out which channels will show Warriors games, and what services you’ll need to be the most informed fan in your friend group.

Jump to:

  • Golden State Warriors channels
  • Golden State Warriors TV schedule
  • Watch the Golden State Warriors for free

Want to watch Golden State Warriors games on TV?

Enter your zip code below to see cable TV providers in your area.

What channel shows the Golden State Warriors?

For the 2024–2025 NBA season, you can watch the Golden State Warriors on a combination of the following channels:

  • NBC Sports Bay Area
  • NBA TV
  • ABC
  • NBC
  • ESPN
  • Amazon Prime Video
  • Peacock

NBC Sports Bay Area is the regional sports network partner of the Golden State Warriors. Residents of central California, southern Oregon, or northern Nevada need a provider with NBC Sports Bay Area to catch most Warriors games. Cable TV providers, including Xfinity, DISH, and DIRECTV, carry NBC Sports Bay Area, as do streaming services like DIRECTV STREAM, YouTube TV, and Peacock.

The NBA’s new media deal replaced TNT with NBC, and also added Prime Video to the mix.

Pro tip: Do you want to watch every Golden State Warriors game but live outside of the Bay Area? Get NBA League Pass or NBA Team Pass for out-of-market team coverage.

Golden State Warriors 2025–2026 TV schedule

The Golden State Warriors are in a tough and tight Western Conference, which means every game during the regular season could mean the difference between home-court advantage in a round or two of the playoffs, or being in the Play-In Tournament. There are a couple of stretches to watch this season.

The first is the six-game road trip in November that includes the defending champion Oklahoma City Thunder, the San Antonio Spurs twice, and the Miami Heat on the second night of a back-to-back. The Warriors have a home-heavy January, but have tough games against OKC, the New York Knicks, and the Milwaukee Bucks.

The last two weeks of the season are particularly challenging. Golden State has San Antonio and the Cleveland Cavaliers on a back-to-back, then play the Houston Rockets, Sacramento Kings, Los Angeles Lakers, and the Kings again in just six days.

Check out the full 82-game schedule below.

How to watch the Golden State Warriors for free

Get free local channels
Editorial rating (4.5/5)
Recommended antenna:
Mohu Leaf 50 ($46.99, one-time purchase*)
Golden State Warriors channels:
ABC, NBC
Features:
All local broadcast channels
View on Amazon
Read Mohu Leaf review

*CableTV.com utilizes paid Amazon links. Amazon.com Price; $46.99 (7/25/25 11:20 a.m. CT). Read full disclaimer.

Interested in watching Golden State games for free? ABC and NBC will get many Warriors matchups this NBA season against teams like the Los Angeles Lakers and Oklahoma City Thunder. You can get ABC and NBC for free by installing an over-the-air antenna like the Mohu Leaf to your TV.

If you’d rather stream Warriors games, you can also grab a free trial from a streaming service like DIRECTV STREAM. Visit our full Streaming Free Trials guide to learn more about streaming TV services with free trial periods.

How to watch the Golden State Warriors FAQ

Where can I watch Golden State today?

Golden State games are available on channels including NBC Sports Bay Area, TNT, and ESPN throughout the NBA season. We’d recommend getting DIRECTV STREAM if you want to watch every local and national Golden State game.

What streaming service has Golden State Warriors?

We recommend DIRECTV STREAM if you’re interested in streaming every Golden State game. DIRECTV carries NBC Sports Bay Area and other broadcast channels for Warriors games this season.

Is NBC Sports Bay Area on YouTube TV?

Yes, YouTube TV has NBC Sports Bay Area and NBC Sports California for those who live in the San Francisco Bay Area and surrounding regions.

Can I watch the Warriors on Amazon?

Yes, Amazon Prime Video will stream several Golden State Warriors games starting in 2025–2026 due to the NBA's new media deal.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com junior sports writer, Alex Vejar, reviewed the full Golden State Warriors schedule to find out every broadcast detail. He also cross-referenced this information with our existing streaming and cord-cutter coverage to help you get the best deal on your NBA viewing plans for the 2025–2026 season.

item.title: What To Watch This Week: Stream Our Top 7 TV and Movie Picks (October 6–12)
item.dc:creator: Randy Harward
item.description:
This week’s “What To Watch” picks include the Tim Robinson comedy The Chair Company on HBO Max, the rock doc Ozzy: No Escape from Now on Paramount+, the gays-in-the-military dramedy BOOTS on Netflix, the drama-thriller The Last Frontier on Apple TV+, and more. Let’s hit the couch!

The post What To Watch This Week: Stream Our Top 7 TV and Movie Picks (October 6–12) appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
CableTV.com’s fall TV preview guide is here!

Embrace cozy season with the best fall TV! The TV experts at CableTV.com have curated a list of top fall TV shows to help you find something to binge-watch while the leaves drop.

New on TV this week

This week’s “What To Watch” picks include the Tim Robinson comedy The Chair Company on HBO Max, the rock doc Ozzy: No Escape from Now on Paramount+, the gays-in-the-military dramedy BOOTS on Netflix, and the drama-thriller The Last Frontier on Apple TV+.

We also have the documentary John Candy: I Like Me on Prime Video, the Halloween special Family Guy: A Little Fright Music on Hulu, and The Baltimorons on video-on-demand (VOD). Let’s hit the couch!

Night owl? Peep what’s on late-night TV this week.

New on Hulu this week

Family Guy: A Little Fright Music | Hulu | Animated special

Special, Monday, October 6: Animated Halloween TV specials, where you get to see your favorite characters in the sort of impossible horrific situations only animation can pull off— Well, they’re a lot of fun. Just look at The Simpsons’ “Treehouse of Horror” legacy. Family Guy might not be as smart as its cartoon counterpart, but its Frankenstein formula of stitched-together gags is well-suited to the Halloween special game. This year, Stewie and Brian are writing a song to beat “Monster Mash”—and you know it’s gonna be a banger.

Best Movies and Shows on Hulu

Pro tip: Looking for a hair-raising series to binge? Check out Sophie Hastings’ The Best Scary Shows Streaming Right Now.

New on Paramount+ this week

Ozzy: No Escape from Now | Paramount+ | Documentary, music

Movie, Tuesday, October 7: ALL ABOAAAARD! It’s not the first Ozzy doc, but it’s the first posthumous official one since the Ozzman shuffled off this mortal coil into immortality, flying high again as he crashes the crazy train through the pearly gates to bark at the Moon from its darkest side. Or something like that. Anyway, this doc is produced in collaboration with his family, so it’ll be heartfelt and hopefully not as exploitative as The Osbournes.

Best Movies and Shows on Paramount+

See what to watch this weekend on all platforms

Click on your favorite streaming service below to see new releases and classic recommendations from our TV critics.

New on Netflix this week

BOOTS | Netflix | Drama

Limited series premiere, Thursday, October 9: BOOTS is the posthumous swan song of Norman Lear, the venerated TV producer who gave us classic TV shows like All in the Family and The Jeffersons. The new series, based on Greg Cope White’s memoir The Pink Marine, is set in the ‘90s, during the gays-in-the-military kerfuffle, and it follows a closeted teen (Miles Heizer) as he enlists in the Marines. Vera Farmiga (Bates Motel, The Conjuring) also stars.

Best Movies and Shows on Netflix

New on Prime Video this week

John Candy: I Like Me | Prime Video | Documentary

Movie, Friday, October 10: Wow. If you’ve seen Planes, Trains, and Automobiles, the title of this doc about the legendary comic actor John Candy hits hard. If you haven’t? No spoilers—but you probably still feel some of the same emotions. No matter what roles he played, Candy’s characters were eminently likeable—even when they’re astonishingly annoying, like in the aforementioned movie. What’s more, I don’t think I’ve ever read a critical word about the IRL guy. We like you, too, John—and it’ll be nice to visit with you again in this movie. RIP.

Best Movies and Shows on Prime Video

Want more new TV shows?

« Catch Up on the Best TV Shows of 2024
Discover the Best TV Shows of 2025 »

New on Apple TV+ this week

The Last Frontier | Apple TV+ | Drama

Limited series premiere, Friday, October 10: When a prison transport plane carrying dozens of violent inmates crashes near an Alaskan town, it’s up to a single U.S. marshal (Jason Clarke) to clean up the mess. In the process, he begins to suspect the crash was intentional and the mess is exponentially worse than he thought. Dallas Goldtooth (Reservation Dogs) also stars.

Read Our Apple TV+ Review

Looking for your next binge-watch?

« Binge an Entire Show This Weekend
Start a Classic Binge-Worthy Show »

New on HBO and HBO Max this week

The Chair Company | HBO, HBO Max | Comedy

Series premiere, Sunday, Oct. 12, 10:00 p.m. ET: The latest vehicle for SNL vet Tim Robinson’s excruciating cringe comedy is this narrative (as opposed to sketch) series. Co-created with Robinson’s frequent partner Zach Kanin (remember Detroiters?), the show follows a man who, after an embarrassing incident at work, ends up investigating a far-reaching conspiracy. Yup, that sounds like a Robinson/Kanin plot. All eight episodes stream today on HBO Max.

Best Movies and Shows on HBO Max

New movie releases available to rent/buy on VOD this week

The Baltimorons (2025) | Rom-com

When a rom-com charms you with only a trailer, you’re a sucker. So I guess that’s me. In this new film from Jay Duplass, a failed, newly sober stand-up comedian enlists the help of a depressed emergency dentist on Christmas Eve, and sparks fly. It doesn’t sound like much, but there’s something about it, y’know? And Duplass (The Puffy Chair, Room 104) is known for quality. We can rent The Baltimorons from video-on-demand (VOD) outlets like Prime Video, Google Movies & TV, and Fandango at Home (formerly VUDU) as of Tuesday, October 7.

VOD releases this week

  • Cloud (Oct. 7) Watch Trailer
  • The Conjuring: Last Rites (Oct. 7) Watch Trailer
  • The Drowned (Oct. 7) Watch Trailer

item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

Just one year removed from winning the World Series, the Los Angeles Dodgers have to try a little harder if they want to get back there.

The Dodgers beat the Cincinnati Reds in the National League Wild Card Series. Now they’re set to play the Philadelphia Phillies in the Division Series, but will have to start with two games on the road. The Dodgers were the only team to sweep their Wild Card series.

Which channels have Los Angeles Dodgers games?

You can catch every 2025 Dodgers games on FOX, FS1, ESPN, MLB Network, TBS, SportsNet LA, and Apple TV+.

If you don’t live in or near the City of Angels, you won’t get access to the regional sports network SportsNet LA. So, if you live somewhere like Baltimore and want to keep up with Ohtani and Yoshinobu Yamamoto among The Boys In Blue, you’ll need MLB.TV or MLB EXTRA INNINGS to watch games broadcasted on this RSN.

Dodgers fans will want ESPN for the final year of Sunday Night Baseball games, and you might also consider signing up for Apple TV+ to stream some Friday Night Baseball games.

Need quicker internet to support streaming live MLB games?

No Dodgers fan wants their stream to lag in the middle of a tied ninth inning. Enter your zip code below to find the best internet providers near you.

How can I watch the Dodgers Spring Training games?

Don’t forget: Toward the end of Spring Training, the Dodgers and Chicago Cubs will kick off the 2025 MLB regular season early on March 18 and 19. The two-game series will take place in Tokyo, Japan, and air on FOX Sports channels.

item.title: How To Watch the 2025 Philadelphia Phillies Season
item.dc:creator: David Vick
item.description:
Is this the year the Phillies win another World Series? Stay tuned with our viewing guide, featuring the complete TV schedule, channel listings, and streaming options.

The post How To Watch the 2025 Philadelphia Phillies Season appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
The Philadelphia Phillies have done a lot of winning over the past three seasons, but they haven’t been able to break through and win a third World Series in franchise history. They came close in 2022, but it wasn’t meant to be. With most of their key players returning from a 95-win season in 2024, this might be the year the “Fightin’ Phils” get the job done.

From the season’s first pitch to the final out, I think the Phillies will be one of the best and most interesting teams to watch in 2025. Stay on this page to find out how you can catch all the action on TV.

Jump to:

  • Philadelphia Phillies channels
  • Best ways to watch the Phillies
  • Philadelphia Phillies TV schedule

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have Philadelphia Phillies games?

You can watch the Phillies play most of their games on NBC Sports Philadelphia (NBCSP), with a handful of regional matchups also airing on NBCSP+ and NBC10 this season. The reigning NL East champs will also play on Apple TV+, ESPN, FOX, FS1, MLB Network, The Roku Channel, and TBS.

If you’re an out-of-market fan, you can watch every regional Phillies broadcast through MLB.TV or MLB EXTRA INNINGS.

Want radio coverage? The Phillies Radio Network offers listening options to fans in Pennsylvania, Delaware, and New Jersey. Spanish-language broadcasts are also available in the Philly area on WTTM 1680 AM.

If you live outside of those three states, you’ll need to use MLB At Bat or SiriusXM to listen to Phillies games.

Best TV plans for watching the Philadelphia Phillies

Do you love options? I sure do. Here are three different ways you can watch the Phillies on TV in 2025. Just keep in mind, games airing on Apple TV+ and The Roku Channel are not available through any traditional TV providers.

Phillies.TV ($24.99/mo.)

Up first on my list of ways to watch the Philadelphia Phillies in 2025 is the team’s standalone in-market TV package, Phillies.TV.

Local fans can access the Phillies.TV subscription through MLB.com and the MLB app to watch every game that airs in the designated Phillies broadcast area. That’s more than 140 games without in-market blackout restrictions. You’ll only miss the games that air exclusively on national TV.

Peacock ($10.99–$16.99/mo.)

If you already have Peacock, this might be the best option for you. The service offers an add-on subscription to NBC Sports Philadelphia for basically the same price ($24.95/mo.) as Phillies.TV. And the nice thing about watching the Phillies on Peacock is you don’t have to download another streaming app.

For those who don’t already have Peacock, you’ll need to purchase the platform’s Premium ($7.99/mo.) or Premium Plus ($13.99/mo.) plan before you buy the NBCSP add-on.

Hulu + Live TV ($81.99–$95.99/mo.)

Hulu + Live TV offers the most complete coverage for fans looking to watch the Phillies this season. It has all the channels you need, and both of its base plans include ESPN+, which is perfect for those who watch more than just baseball.

I also love Hulu + Live TV because it doesn’t charge a fee to watch regional sports networks like NBC Sports Philadelphia.

Score the best TV plan!

Enter your zip code below to see your area’s top TV providers.

Philadelphia Phillies playoffs TV schedule

The Phillies had themselves a stellar season and were rewarded with a spot in the National League Division Series. They’ll play the Los Angeles Dodgers, who beat the Cincinnati Reds in the Wild Card series in two games.

Check out the NLDS schedule below. I’ll be updating it as soon as there’s more information available.

How to watch the Philadelphia Phillies FAQ

Can I watch the Philadelphia Phillies for free?

Yes, you can watch the Philadelphia Phillies for free with an over-the-air antenna when games air on channels like NBC10 (in the Philly area) and FOX. Check out the FCC’s Reception Map Tool to see which channels are available where you live.

What apps can I watch Phillies games on this season?

You can watch Philadelphia Phillies games on several apps in 2025, depending on the broadcaster for each game and your own TV subscriptions. Here are some of the apps you can use:

  • Apple TV
  • ESPN
  • FOX Sports
  • MLB
  • Peacock
  • Roku
  • Watch TBS

Is NBC Sports Philadelphia+ an overflow channel?

Yes, NBC Sports Philadelphia+ is an overflow channel that’s used when multiple local teams (Phillies, Flyers, 76ers) play games at the same time. Even when there’s no scheduling conflict, the channel sometimes airs extra content not shown on the main NBC Sports Philadelphia channel.

Why do the Phillies play on so many channels in 2025?

Along with the three local channels that broadcast Phillies games, the team is likely playing on so many national channels in 2025 because they’re expected to have a good season.

Why you should trust us

To create this watch guide, I carefully reviewed multiple sources that provided key details about the Philadelphia Phillies’ 2025 broadcast schedule. After several hours of research, I identified and recommended three distinct ways for fans to watch the Phillies this season. All three options have unique strengths that make them stand out.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

item.title: How To Watch the Milwaukee Brewers in 2025
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
The Milwaukee Brewers return for this MLB season looking to build on last year’s National League Central triumph. Fortunately, you can watch all Brewers games live with the right channels in your TV roster.

The post How To Watch the Milwaukee Brewers in 2025 appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

Looking to watch the Milwaukee Brewers today? Fortunately, you can catch all Brewers games live with the right channels and TV setup.

The Brew Crew is rolling through the 2025 MLB season with a ton of momentum, proving last year’s National League Central triumph was no fluke. With head coach Pat Murphy at the helm, the team is embracing a new era—navigating through changes while keeping its World Series dreams alive.

Although MLB was going to take over broadcasting the Brewers’ in-market games, the team ultimately struck a deal to keep local matchups on FanDuel Sports Wisconsin (formerly Bally Sports Wisconsin). That means many TV details remain unchanged from last season. But keep reading, as I outline this season’s viewing specifics—including the complete TV schedule and free viewing options.

  • Milwaukee Brewers channels
  • Milwaukee Brewers TV schedule
  • Spring Training schedule
  • Watch the Brewers for free

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have Milwaukee Brewers games?

You can watch in-market Milwaukee Brewers games on FanDuel Sports Network Wisconsin (FDSWI), with select simulcasts airing on over-the-air affiliates throughout Wisconsin. Nationally televised games will appear on FOX, FS1, ESPN, TBS, and MLB Network, while some will stream on Apple TV+ and The Roku Channel.

If you live outside the FanDuel Sports Wisconsin broadcast region, you’ll need MLB.TV or MLB EXTRA INNINGS for out-of-market viewing.

Want radio coverage? Fans can stream home and away radio broadcasts of every Brewers game on MLB At Bat. Games also air on AM and FM stations within the Brewers Radio Network, featuring announcers Jeff Levering, Lane Grindle, and Josh Maurer.

Score the best Milwaukee Brewers TV plan

Enter your zip code below to see top TV and internet providers in your area.

2025 Milwaukee Brewers playoffs TV schedule

The Brewers began the 2025 MLB season with an Opening Day loss against the New York Yankees. In fact, they lost that entire opening series. But you wouldn’t know it now, as Milwaukee rolled into October with the spot in the National League Division Series.

Starting Saturday, October 4, the Brewers will start their journey toward a World Series against the Chicago Cubs, who beat the San Diego Padres in the Wild Card series.

You can watch select Milwaukee Brewers games for free on ABC and FOX using an over-the-air (OTA) antenna, which requires no TV subscription. To identify channels in your area, enter your zip code in the FCC’s Reception Map Tool. Then, explore our Best OTA Antennas page for recommendations, including the mid-range Mohu Leaf 50.

Free MLB games also stream daily on MLB.TV. All you need is an MLB.com account to tune in, but blackout restrictions apply for in-market fans.

Another way to watch free games is through a live TV streaming trial. DIRECTV STREAM offers a free five-day trial with core MLB channels and RSNs, including FanDuel Sports Wisconsin. Other free trials are regularly available through Fubo and YouTube TV.

How to watch the Milwaukee Brewers FAQ

Can I watch the Brewers game on Amazon Prime?

Yes, out-of-market Brewers fans can watch games on Amazon Prime Video through the MLB.TV Prime Video Channels add-on. In-market coverage is also available on Prime Video with the FanDuel Sports Network add-on.

Have the Brewers returned to FanDuel Sports Network?

Yes, Brewers games will remain on FanDuel Sports Network (formerly Bally Sports) for the 2025 MLB season. In December 2024, the Brewers announced that they reached an agreement for FanDuel Sports Network to produce and distribute the team’s telecasts for another year.

How can I watch the Brewers on Spectrum?

Spectrum TV customers can watch nationally televised Brewers games on ESPN, FOX Sports, and TNT Sports channels. In-market fans can get FanDuel Sports Wisconsin with the TV Select Plus plan, while MLB EXTRA INNINGS is available for out-of-market fans.

Does YouTube TV carry Brewers games?

Yes, YouTube TV carries select Brewers games that air nationally. But the live TV streaming service doesn’t offer FanDuel Sports Wisconsin, MLB Network, or MLB.TV access.

How can I stream the Brewers?

You can stream Milwaukee Brewers games on any live TV streaming service that offers ESPN, FOX Sports, and TNT Sports channels. Sling TV is an inexpensive option, but I recommend DIRECTV STREAM for better in-market coverage. You can also stream in-market games on FanDuel Sports Network and out-of-market coverage on MLB.TV.

Why you should trust us

As a Wisconsin native and lifelong Brewers fan, our CableTV.com Sports Editor, Taylor Kujawa, knows exactly what it takes to follow the Brew Crew. For this guide, he combined that fan passion with expert analysis, cross-referencing the full 2025 schedule with the channel lineups and pricing of every major TV provider to find the best deals for Brewers fans.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

item.title: How To Watch the 2025 Chicago Cubs Season
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
The 2025 Chicago Cubs season marks the 154th chapter of this storied franchise. After a challenging 2024 campaign, manager Craig Counsell now faces the crucial task of getting the Cubs back to the MLB Playoffs.

The post How To Watch the 2025 Chicago Cubs Season appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

The 2025 Chicago Cubs season marks the 154th chapter of this storied franchise. After a challenging 2024 campaign, manager Craig Counsell now faces the crucial task of getting the Cubs back to the MLB Playoffs.

This year, in-market games will continue airing on Marquee Sports Network—the exclusive home for Cubs action since 2020. Marquee is available as a standalone streaming subscription and through various TV providers, ensuring local fans get the best coverage.

With renewed energy and the potential for a playoff push, it’s time to rally behind the Cubbies. Keep reading to learn how to watch the Chicago Cubs live on TV this season, from Wrigley Field showdowns to thrilling road games.

Jump to:

  • Chicago Cubs channels
  • Chicago Cubs TV schedule
  • Chicago Cubs Spring Training schedule
  • Watch the Chicago Cubs for free

Don’t miss the Chicago Cubs on TV

Gear up for yearlong baseball action, from Spring Training to the World Series. Enter your zip code below to see the best TV and internet providers in your area.

What channels have Chicago Cubs games?

Most Chicago Cubs games air locally on Marquee Sports Network, except for select nationally televised matchups. Those games air nationwide on FOX, FS1, ESPN, TBS, and MLB Network, with some streaming on Apple TV+ and The Roku Channel.

Out-of-market viewers need MLB.TV or MLB EXTRA INNINGS to watch the Marquee Sports Network games. But some out-of-market matchups also stream on ESPN+.

Pro tip: MLB At Bat has home and away audio broadcasts of every Chicago Cubs game without blackout restrictions. You can also listen to games on select AM and FM stations across the Midwest via the Chicago Cubs Radio Network.

2025 Chicago Cubs playoff TV schedule

The Chicago Cubs began the 2025 season with the two-game MLB Tokyo Series against the Los Angeles Dodgers at Tokyo Dome in Japan. After the brief international tour, the Cubs returned stateside for more preseason action before the regular season proper began on March 27.

As the season unfolds, you can expect thrilling matchups against National League rivals and American League powerhouses. So, mark your calendars because we’ve laid out the full TV schedule below, complete with start times and channel listings.

Chicago got past the Wild Card series against the San Diego Padres, and now the focus shifts to the Division Series against the Milwaukee Brewers. The team’s full schedule is below. I’ll update it as more information becomes available.

How to watch Chicago Cubs Spring Training games

Marquee Sports Network will broadcast the majority of the Chicago Cubs’ Spring Training games, including most Sloan Park matchups. Depending on your location, select games may also air live on MLB Network.

The 2025 Cactus League kicks off on Thursday, February 20, when the Cubs take on the Los Angeles Dodgers. I’m especially excited about this matchup since the Cubs and Dodgers will face off again in mid-March during the MLB Tokyo Series.

With a jam-packed spring schedule featuring 29 games—including split-squad contests, exhibition matches in Tokyo, and two MLB Spring Breakout games—this preseason promises plenty of action to gear us up for the regular season. Check out the full Cubs Spring Training TV schedule below.

You can use an over-the-air (OTA) antenna to catch some Chicago Cubs games on FOX for free this season. Antennas aren’t free, but you don’t need a TV subscription. Just use the FCC’s Reception Map Tool to check your area’s channels. Then, visit our Best OTA Antennas page for recommendations like the Mohu Leaf 50, which is ideal for suburban households.

Another viewing option is the Free Game of the Day on MLB.TV. Create an account on MLB.com to stream a free game each day of the regular season, but be aware of potential regional blackouts.

You can also try a free live TV streaming trial from services like DIRECTV STREAM, Fubo, and YouTube TV. Our top pick for MLB action is DIRECTV STREAM, which has core national channels and most RSNs—including Marquee Sports Network and Chicago Sports Network.

How to watch the Chicago Cubs FAQ

What streaming service has Chicago Cubs games?

Most live TV streaming services have Cubs games, but DIRECTV STREAM is our favorite because of its national and in-market coverage. MLB.TV is available for streaming out-of-market games, while Apple TV+ shows exclusive matches.

How can I watch Marquee without cable?

You can watch Marquee Sports Network without cable via a standalone online subscription for $19.99 per month. The channel is also available through DIRECTV STREAM and Fubo, but you must live within the Cubs TV territory to watch live in-market games.

Can I watch Cubs games on Amazon Prime?

Yes, out-of-market Cubs fans can watch games on Amazon Prime Video by getting an MLB.TV subscription through Prime Video Channels.

Are Cubs games on Sling TV?

Yes, you can watch nationally televised Cubs games on Sling TV. But you’ll need the Sling Orange + Blue plan to get ESPN and FOX Sports channels together. MLB Network and MLB Network Strike Zone are available in the Sports Extra add-on.

Where can I watch the Iowa Cubs game?

Some Iowa Cubs games air on Marquee Sports Network. But most Minor League Baseball games stream on MLB At Bat via MLB.TV—including most matchups featuring the Cubs’ Triple-A affiliate.
